TopicTitle: Rover wheels stuck driving backwards full speed

Articles.Content: I built a very simple rover with the mk2 lander can rover and RobeMax model m1 rover wheels with batteries and solar panels and when I launch it starts driving backwards and the only way to stop it is to put brakes on and disable motor. Anyone know the issue?

2 hours ago, Rex2030 said:

I built a very simple rover with the mk2 lander can rover and RobeMax model m1 rover wheels with batteries and solar panels and when I launch it starts driving backwards and the only way to stop it is to put brakes on and disable motor. Anyone know the issue?

Small tip, if you go to Main Menu->Settings->Input->Vessel at the bottom there is a section called Wheels, i suggest you re bind them with buttons other than WSAD, so you can control rovers

without messing with the SAS etc and causing weird handling issues.

I am not sure thats your problem, a picture would help, but having seperate controls from Flight and Wheels helps.

Edited August 13, 2020 by Boyster
Thanks, will do. Issue still persist

If I recall correctly, having trim applied will cause rovers to believe they are being given movement orders. Try hitting alt-X to remove any trim effects you may have inadvertently put on. 

Oh, and thread moved to Gameplay Questions, since it's seeking help rather than offering it.
